name: Fusion Suites Saigon
address: 3-5 Suong Nguyet Anh, Quận 1, TP. Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam
description:
Nằm trong bán kính 300 m từ Công viên Tao Đàn ở Quận 1, Fusion Suites Saigon cung cấp chỗ nghỉ hiện đại tại Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh nhộn nhịp. Khách sạn có quầy lễ tân 24 giờ, trung tâm thể dục và nhà hàng trong khuôn viên.

Mỗi phòng nghỉ tại Fusion Suites Saigon đều được trang bị máy điều hòa, cửa sổ vách kính, TV màn hình phẳng, bếp nhỏ cũng như phòng tắm riêng với bồn tắm hoặc vòi sen, dép, áo choàng tắm và đồ vệ sinh cá nhân miễn phí.

Fusion Suites Saigon cách Dinh Thống Nhất cũng như Bảo tàng Chứng tích Chiến tranh 800 m. Sân bay gần nhất là sân bay quốc tế Tân Sơn Nhất, cách đó 7 km.

Với khu vực ghế ngồi ở trong nhà và ngoài trời, nhà hàng Fresh phục vụ nhiều món ăn hấp dẫn của Việt Nam và quốc tế.

review.rating: Modernes Hotel mit Fokus auf dem Wesentlichen
review.comment_positive:
Die moderne Einrichtung hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Alles war darauf ausgerichtet hochwertig und praktisch zugleich zu sein. Das Bad war sauber, groß und bot mit einer ebenerdig begehbaren Dusche mit edlen Spendern für Shampoo etc alles was man brauchte.

Das Frühstücksbuffet bot für jeden etwas, von westlich bis fernost, von Obst über Brot und Ei bis zur Nudelsuppe. Die Auswahl an Kaffee/Kakaospezialitäten war erfreulich groß und die angebotenen Säfte frisch. Vielleicht insgesamt nicht die größte Auswahl, dafür alles in guter Qualität.

Einmal habe ich im Restaurant zu Abend gegessen. Die Qualität war gut, aber es war jetzt kein wirklich aufregendes Erlebnis. Der Preis an dieser Stelle vielleicht etwas hoch, aber noch ok.

Insgesamt kann man zum Essen sagen, dass das Hotel hier ganz klar einen super Kurs fährt, der mehr Wert auf frische und Qualität legt und nicht so sehr auf "klassische Hotelkategorien" wie Masse und Dekoschnickschnack.

Der Wäscheservice war gut, nichts dran auszusetzen.

Die angebotenen Privattouren waren sehr gut. Ich habe sowohl die Zweitagestour ins Delta als auch die Ganztagestour zum Caodai Tempel und zu den Cu Chi Tunneln gemacht. Die Touren waren vor allem auf Grund des engagierten und authentischen Guides top. Der Preis als Alleinreisender für diese Touren hat es allerdings in sich. Ich würde aber auf Grund der Tollen Erlebnisse die Touren wieder buchen.

Das Personal war sehr bemüht und freundlich, und dabei immer authentisch. Bei meiner Anreise gab es leider ein kleines Durcheinander, wodurch mein Flughafentransfer nicht kam. Nun Fehler passieren, aber das war natürlich ärgerlich. Als Entschuldigung hat mir das Hotel den Transfer zurück zum Flughafen geschenkt. Eine sehr aufmerksame Geste. Für den Hintransfer wurde mir natürlich nichts berechnet.

Insgesamt habe ich mich im Hotel sehr wohl gefühlt.
review.comment_negative: Persönlich fand ich die Temperatur im Speisebereich etwas kühl. Gerade wenn man von draußen kam um sich bei einem Getränk etwas zu erholen konnte einem schonmal etwas kühl werden. Aber hier gehen die Empfindlichkeiten sicher auseinander.

review.rating: Wunderschönes & modernes Hotel - ideal um Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon) zu entdecken
review.comment_positive:
Tolles Hotel in guter Lage um Ho Chi Minh Stadt (Saigon) zu entdecken.
Das Hotel ist modern und mit viel Liebe zum Detail gestaltet und bietet wirklich große Zimmer die wunderschön gestaltet sind. Das Personal ist freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Das Frühstücks-Büffet ist sehr umfang- und abwechslungsreich - da ist für jeden was dabei.
Die Lage ist sehr gut um die Stadt zu Fuß oder mit Hilfe von Grab o.ä. zu erkunden.
Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist sehr sehr gut.
Wir können das Hotel uneingeschränkt weiterempfehlen.

review.rating: Memorable, but not for the right reasons.
review.comment_positive: We were able to secure early check-in, so this was incredibly helpful when you had an early flight. The rooms were as advertised and we were pretty happy with the room. I do think their aesthetics is the main selling point as they fell short on other aspects based on my stay. There was ample space and toiletries provided were in a large bottle, not the travel sized kind so we didn't need to reach out to housekeeping during our stay. There was also a spa right opposite the hotel and a minimart around 200m walk away. Breakfast selection was adequate given the price we paid; three hot trays, one cold section, bread and cereal, coffee bar counter and a live station. The menu doesn't differ much each day but you could always have a more rustic experience outside with small eateries nearby.
review.comment_negative:
Things didn't start off well with a blackout on the first day. Every time we asked for an update on when electricity and wifi would resume, they would say in an hour which ended up to be a 6-hour wait. There was no service recovery whatsoever as well. Breakfast staff were quite flustered and disorganized but easily fixable once they figure out a system to allocate different table orders. We kept getting incorrect food delivered to us and spent half the time sending it back. I do wish the juice bottles came in a larger bottle instead of 750ml bottles so there was no need depend on replenishment. 

There is a kitchenette in the room but there was no cutleries or crockeries we could use, so that was a shame as they advertised as a eco-friendly hotel but we ended up having to depend on takeaway utensils. Cleanliness around the hotel could be improved - there were multiple dead cockroaches in the gym area. The gym was also located at the basement; which is fine but there was no air conditioner or fresh air, so you have to do your workout with loud standing fans in the background.

review.comment_positive: The room was so spacious and clean.
Le camere, belle ampie spaziose in stile minimal con molto legno naturale. Il bagno grande e ben strutturato, in generale la struttura è molto bella ed è situata in una via tranquilla.

The bathroom was really spacious and had the best shower you can have. The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning was working very well. The breakfast was decent, although not as extensive as in other hotels I stayed at in Vietnam.
review.comment_negative: Although nobody of the staff was unfriendly to us, I did get the impression that most staff members had an attitude of leaving the guests alone as much as possible. For instance, many times when we entered the hotel, nobody at the reception desk would greet us. If you need something, they will definitely help you, but overall it felt a bit impersonal.

review.comment_positive: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  The location of the hotel itself in District 1 seemed to be in a bit more of a 'local' area as it is away from bars and shops, with lots of coffee places around.  That said, it is very cheap to get around Ho Chi Minh via Grab (the Uber equivalent) so not so much of a problem.  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  The room was lovely.  Check your room though because the photo for the room is not what you automatically get,  Our room had one very small window above head height.  It was quite light when open, but it is definitely not the picture on the front.  There was a power cut while we were there on one afternoon and they put on snacks and a drink for the inconvenience.

review.rating: A simple, stylish, well equipped hotel that can do better
review.comment_positive: The hotel was nice located in a relatively quiet street, not far from the main touristic sites of the colonial area. A big plus is a fantastic Thai massage salon located in front, just across the street. The room we took (a corner suite) was spacious, well equipped with design furniture and noise-proof despite the large floor-to- ceiling panoramic window. We did not hear any unpleasant noise while at sleep. All staff spoke good English and communication was smooth.
review.comment_negative: The breakfast was served in a hall that also served as the main passage between the reception and the lifts we did not have quiet moments while eating, but some people may like this. The quality of breads were substandard against European norms but certainly acceptable. The choice of fresh fruits was a bit limited and when I asked why they do not put wonderful local mangoes on the plate I was told that it was available against payment. Overall, everything was well maintained but had Ann impression that attentiveness was sometimes lacking (e.g. no explanation to the always flashing red message lamp on the room phone, empty bactericidal gel dispenser in the lifts). I may stay again in this hotel.

A couple of days later, my key card stopped working again and they had to send an engineer to fix it. Guests should not have to waste time dealing with this kind of inconvenience.

Laundry service indicated that laundry would be returned by 7 pm same day if given to staff before 9 am, yet I had to call after 8 pm because I had still not received my clothes.

Overall, I don't think the guest experience delivered is consistent with the price I paid.

review.room_type: Phòng Giường Đôi Không có Cửa sổ
review.comment_positive: L'hébergement est correct, il y a un excellent petit déjeuner mixte oriental/occidental qui change tous les jours, le staff à l'accueil est très sympathique, certains maîtrisent bien l'anglais et l'emplacement est relativement bon car un peu au calme par rapport au centre. J'ai apprécié le verre offert à l'arrivée et le petit snack dans la chambre. Le wifi est bon mais sans plus.
review.comment_negative: Cela dit, l'aménagement de la chambre n'est pas bon: le lavabo à l'autre bout de la salle de bain, ça ne va pas. La lumière au dessus du lavabo est très mauvaise, personne ne peut se raser/se maquiller correctement avec une lumière pareille. Et le lavabo n'est pas conforme niveau sécurité. L'écoulement de la douche passe devant les toilettes, et donc toute la zone des toilettes reste mouillée, ce qui n'est pas agréable. Malgré l'emplacement dans une rue calme, il y avait tout de même trop de bruit pour moi: le frigo et la climatisation ne sont pas très silencieux, on entend des ventilateurs extérieurs, on entend les bruits de la rue même aux étages élevés et les portes ne sont pas insonorisées et font beaucoup de bruit. Il y a aussi un coq pas loin qui vous réveille à 5h30-6h00 ce qui n'est pas très agréable. Le lit n'est pas si confortable que cela et un peu court. Donc le prix est trop cher pour ce que c'est. Seuls la gentillesse du personnel et le petit déjeuner m'empêchent de mettre une plus mauvaise note.

review.rating: For the price of our stay and the room we got, I didn't think the price was justifiable.
review.comment_positive: The organic furnishing of the property makes us feel very relaxed.  I like the outdoor deck and the quietness surrounding the property.
review.comment_negative:
I would've expected better hygiene.  Our pillows had a really bad and stale odour I had to put up with on the first night we checked in.  However, I requested for a change of pillows the next day and the housekeeping had it changed immediately. 

There wasn't any recycled bin in the room for a hotel that promotes sustainability...  Quite odd.

There might also have been a misunderstanding on my part.  I had expected a bathtub for the room that I've booked as it was shown in the room selection... And it turns out, none.  I was rather disappointed. 

The gym was very basic but it was located in the basement with no views.  Quite scary to be working out alone as there was no one, and no attendants.

Coffee was good at the restaurant but I didn't get to try anything else since our room didn't come with breakfast.  Thought for the price we paid, breakfast would've been inclusive.

Location wise, it's rather convenient to get to most of the places we were heading, with grab rides.  The only down side is that there is not much of decent food choices surrounding the stay within walking distance and so we had to grab to get to food.

review.comment_positive: Apartment was modern, beautiful, had everything you need and was extremely comfortable! The customer service was also wonderful.
Trendy rooms in a central location in Saigon.
The hotel leaves a great first impression. The interior design is beautiful. It's got a great vibe. The staff is very friendly and helpful, too.
review.comment_negative: For what looks to be a very new hotel, all the facilities are quite run down. There were just too many signs of daily wear and tear, and a general lack of care. For example, our bathtub has some built up scum and was chipped around the rim, and the floor underneath was visibly unclean. The plug did not even fit properly until we raised the issue. (To their credit, it was fixed immediately.) There were marks in the bathroom walls and on the windows from (hopefully) condensation. We had a tray with visible cigarette burn marks in our bathroom that just sat there. The sofa had some marks here and there that just didn't look clean. It's just these minor issues that are too trivial to speak up about, but they add up to bring down the whole experience because it's got such potential. For what they charge, surely there's got to be a better option in town.

review.comment_negative: Breakfast. Not what we can expect from Fusion 4 stars group. For example, Fusion Menu usually offers 5 specific Fusion Poke items. Just one was available and not well prepared with white rice in place of brown rice. No otmeal or no beef to prepare others items. No cheese too. No meat. Only white rice, some fruits and vegetables and cereals for kids. Breakfast was a big deception. I advise to avoid such a situation to make orders the day before and prepare a breakfast without deception for customers. Our journey at Fusion Saigon was very good but we leave the place with this bad feeling of deception and this is not normal for a 4 stars Fusion Group Hotel.

review.comment_positive: Tasteful design. Good soundproof. Polite staffs. Microwave oven & pantry space.
review.comment_negative:
I hope the hotel will put in effort in up-keeping their beautifully designed rooms. During my 5 days stay we changed room three times. 
1st move: we booked a double room, they gave us twins, even though they'd double checked with us minutes before checking us in. 
2nd move: the room's sofa & head board had off-putting stains on them, we asked for change & for higher floor, which the staff gave us one on the top floor. 
3rd move: a massive leakage in the room when there was a heavy down pour. Puddle formed within minutes, it was startling! The hotel staff moved us to their corner suite. In any case I hope they will up their effort in maintaining their property.

review.comment_positive:
Das Zimmer ist groß und sauber. Die Einrichtung ist modern und stylisch. 
Die Personal sind nett.
review.comment_negative:
1. Das Frühstück ist langweilig und könnte besser sein für den Preis, was man hier bezahlt. 

2. Wir haben Room Service bestellt. Nach dem wir fertig waren, haben wir das Geschirr im Flur neben der Tür gestellt. Die lagen da für 2 Tage und niemand hat es abgeholt, bis wir bei der Rezeption gemeldet haben.

3. Aber was wir am schlimmsten finden, ist das Pickup Service bzw. das Konzept von privater Abholung, was dieses Hotel ausgedacht hat. Es ist für uns fast wie ein Betrug. 
Wir sind mit zwei 80 jährigen Leuten verreist und wollten nicht, dass sie lange auf eine Taxisuche laufen müssen. Deswegen haben wir das Pickup-Service von dem Hotel gebucht. Als wir in den Flughafen angekommen sind, war niemand mit unserem Namenschild wie versprochen vor Ort, um uns zu dem Auto zu führen. 
Stattdessen mussten wir mit unseren Großeltern selber zu einem Autovermietung-Stand laufen. Erstmal die Mitarbeiterin vor Ort erklären, dass wir ein Auto von dem Hotel gebucht haben. Sie hat natürlich davon nichts gewusst und musste erstmal rumfragen. 

Danach mussten wir mit ihr für 10 Minuten zu dem normalen Taxi-Stand in dem Flughafen laufen, um in das Auto einsteigen zu können. Das Auto ist wie ein normales Taxi. 

Für dieses ganzes angenehmes Pickup haben wir 650.000 VND bezahlt. 
Aber was lächerlich ist, wir haben an dem Abreisetag selber ein Taxi zum Flughafen genommen. Das Auto ist genauso groß und alles hat 150.000 VND gekostet. Das Hotel hat einfach 4-fach mehr berechnet. Aber für was??? 

Wir wissen, dass Pickup Service vom Hotel immer mehr kostet. Wir sind damit auch einverstanden. Aber dafür erwarten wir auch ein besseres Auto und jemanden, der uns direkt beim Ausgang begrüßt und zum Auto bringt. 

Zusammengefasst, egal wie schön und sauber dieses Hotel ist, mit dieser Erfahrung würde ich es nie weiter empfehlen!

review.comment_positive: I had the Corner Suite Room on the 9th floor for 4 days, it was lovely. I’m glad I chose this hotel over the others located in District 1. I was able to work during evening hours as it was quiet. My room was clean and prepped daily with water bottles restocked. The staff always asked me if I needed anything, new towels or room service. They called me to remind about my free spa service. The conditioning of the room was very good. Hot water was working in the bath. The tub was spectacular, worked well and wasn’t leaking. I loved my stay and would definitely go back!!! The breakfast was a variety from Vietnamese to Continental dishes but I was always on the go so I’ve only eaten on the last morning of my stay. They have cassava cake and banana muffins which was a win for me! The hotel also allowed me to do an early check in as the room was ready so I was able to rest at 11am. They also held my luggage when I checked out, my flight was evening time, they allowed me to roam the city and keep my luggage in their safety, and coming back, they allowed to use the shower area for free if I wanted to freshen up. Excellent service and everyone spoke and understood English very well!! They also have 24hrs room service, I ordered a meal at 12 midnight because I was hungry.
review.comment_negative: While everything was well, I was a bit let down with the masseuse insisting on giving a tip. I would give tips if I liked the service but pushing for it was a bit out of touch.

review.rating: 1 Star Hotel with 5 Star Prices & abysmal service.
review.comment_positive: Nothing was good about this property. It’s a 1 or 2 star hotel with 5 star prices. The room was not as advertised. Horrible service.
review.comment_negative:
The reservation was for 2 twin beds. The room had 2 single beds (photo below). When I asked management for a twin bed, they said 2 single beds equals a twin. If so, I should have gotten 4 single beds—two for each twin but they weren’t willing to take the logic that far. Even if all they had was singles, management clearly didn’t care and wouldn’t offer me anything different or even the option to cancel and go to a different hotel.

The room smelled bad and the carpet was ratty. There was a yellow sticky substance that hadn’t been cleaned in the entryway.

The ‘included’ breakfast was plain bread. I asked if I could have an egg to go with the bread and they said I would have to pay extra. $11 for a plain bread breakfast in HCMC is ridiculous for any hotel.

review.comment_negative:
Overpriced for what you get.

Cold water in the gym shower.
Room service is not thorough, e.g. our rubbish bin was never taken out for the duration of our stay of 4 days despite it was full all the time, bathroom supply was not filled up, tea refill was never provided, despite we left the tea box open the second day.

Staff is very polite, but still does not speak English well enough to respond to more complex requests outside of standard.

Got toilet blocked very unexpectedly.

Room view is not nearly as what is advertised on the photos.

No swimming pool.
Meeting room at extra fee. For what you pay it should be free.

Airport transfer is overpriced, get grab instead.

Cafe downstairs is lovely, but ridiculously overpriced as well.

review.comment_positive: We loved our stay here.  Tucked on a side street away from all traffic.  We had a corner room so the space and brightness was amazing.  The decor reminded me of minimal European.  Very tasteful.  Breakfast was very nice and there is a space to eat outside in front of the hotel that was great... also nice for an afternoon glass of wine!  Location was perfect.  We were able to walk to many things including the Market and the main downtown area.  Just down the street is an amazing Vegetarian Restaurant we just happened to find.  Highly recommend even if you are not vegetarian!  Loved our stay.

The street the hotel is on is great as well, filled with at least 3-4 cafes and super nearby to all your big touristy spots. Also only about a 5-15 minute walk away from great street and fancy local food.

Spa treatment was nice, albeit rather expensive.

review.rating: Very comfortable, great location with tremendous staff!
review.room_type: Suite Ở Góc Với Ưu Đãi Spa
review.comment_positive: We had a fantastic room, with fantastic staff. Plenty of space in a quiet part of the city, only 5 minutes walk from all the chaos, history and excitement that is Ho Chi Minh. It's unlikely we could have found better accommodation and such great value. The breakfast was included and was a sizeable spread. Their coffee was delicious, the gym was well equipped for a hotel gym and the massages were a welcome addition. Furthermore our flight was delayed 5 hours. The hotel organised a late pick up and a 3am check in at very short notice. We left a wallet in the safe and they couriered it to our next hotel, free of charge. A great stay! A brilliant experience.

review.rating: Great stay, peaceful location in tasteful, contemporary accommodation
review.comment_positive: A little further away from being at the heart of all of the action meant a 1-2km walk to everywhere. However, this proved to be a good decision. As HCMC is full on, noisy with lots of hustle and bustle, a quiet location suited us. The suite itself was lovely, fresh and modern with a great city view. The kitchenette and second bunk bedroom were a welcome addition. Reception staff were helpful after a series of delayed flights pushed our check in until after midnight they were helpful in liaising with our driver. Left luggage (free of charge) was great on our last day and again, staff were helpful in calling taxis throughout our stay. A very comfortable suite in a peaceful location.
review.comment_negative: No complaints. Kitchenette would benefit from a few additions such as additional glasses, some dinner plates and a sharp knife. Saying that, given the cost of eating out, you’re unlikely to need much in terms of cooking equipment. Adequate for organising breakfast and snacks.

review.rating: nice design & value with friendly staff.
review.comment_positive: the design & value.

Beautiful establishment with a very unique decor style. Everything is japandi/Scandinavian style and beautifully decorated. This felt like a very nice hotel and although it was much pricier relative to Vietnam and compared to some other, it was still very affordable for what we got. The decor and furnishings felt new but the hotel also  felt like it might have been an older hotel or building that was renovated. There were some things that didn’t feel as seamless such as the weird carpeting in the elevator and and control panels felt a little mix and match. Aside from that everything still felt very comfortable and our room was spacious. It felt like we were in an entirely different country. Some rooms you can book which includes a free daily massage but we chose one that did not include this. If you want to it’s very affordable relative to the US but you can get cheaper outside of the hotel.
review.comment_negative: Breakfast buffet was the least impressive out of all the hotels we stayed at in Vietnam. Selection is ok, pho was just ok, coffee is not bad. We may have been spoiled at our previous hotels.
